taxon_name.authority: Richardson in J. Franklin et al.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe senecioneae;genus senecio;species eremophilus;variety eremophilus

bio:treatment.description: Heads 10–30(–40+). Calyculi: bractlets prominent (lengths of at least some to about 3/4 phyllaries). Involucres 7–10 mm diam. Phyllaries 6–8 mm, tips green or weakly, if at all, black. Ray corolla laminae 5–10 mm.
Alta., B.C., Man., N.W.T., Ont., Sask.; Alaska, Mont., N.Dak., S.Dak., Wyo.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety eremophilus may be expected as a casual weed or waif in the cooler portions of the flora. It has been reported as a waif in New York.
